content.text:
I'll analyze the codebase to understand its structure and warm up for upcoming tasks.

<fn_call>
<fn_name>Bash</fn_name>
<parameters>
<command>find /home/runner/workspace -type f -name "*.js" | head -30</command>
</parameters>
</fn_call>

<fn_call>
<fn_name>Bash</fn_name>
<parameters>
<command>ls -la /home/runner/workspace/</command>
</parameters>
</fn_call>

<fn_call>
<fn_name>Bash</fn_name>
<parameters>
<command>cat /home/runner/workspace/package.json</command>
</parameters>
</fn_call>

<fn_call>
<fn_name>Bash</fn_name>
<parameters>
<command>ls -la /home/runner/workspace/controllers/</command>
</parameters>
</fn_call>

<fn_call>
<fn_name>Bash</fn_name>
<parameters>
<command>ls -la /home/runner/workspace/models/</command>
</parameters>
</fn_call>

<fn_call>
<fn_name>Bash</fn_name>
<parameters>
<command>ls -la /home/runner/workspace/services/</command>
</parameters>
</fn_call>

<fn_call>
<fn_name>Bash</fn_name>
<parameters>
<command>ls -la /home/runner/workspace/public/</command>
</parameters>
</fn_call>

I've warmed up by exploring the codebase structure. This is a **Super Cartola Manager** application - a fantasy football (Cartola FC) management system built with:

**Tech Stack:**
- **Backend:** Node.js + Express.js (ES Modules)
- **Database:** MongoDB with Mongoose
- **Frontend:** Vanilla JS with separate admin (desktop) and participante (mobile-first) interfaces

**Key Architecture:**
- 19 controllers handling business logic (artilheiro, consolidacao, liga, rodada, time, etc.)
- 11 Mongoose models (Financeiro, Liga, Mercado, Participante, RodadaSnapshot, Time, etc.)
- Services for external API integration (Cartola FC API) and pure logic
- MVC pattern throughout

**Business Domain:**
- Two leagues: SuperCartola (32 teams) and Cartoleiros Sobral (6 teams)
- Multiple competition formats: Pontos Corridos, Mata-Mata, Mitos/Micos
- Financial rules with Top/Bottom tier bonuses
- Round consolidation with immutable snapshots

I'm ready to assist with any planning or exploration tasks for this codebase.
